defs: a variety of date palm tree of Arecaceae family known for its excellent sweet, fleshy fruit.
the fruit itself.
(said of animals) to go away or be separated from the group, flock, etc.
to come together; to form a group.
a dance performed by a troup, chiefly as a religious service to a god.
the state or fact of not having a son to offer oblations to the manes after one's death.
any being brought forth alive by its mother to this world (as in the case of mammals and some other animals, contrary to oviparous beings that come from eggs); any viviparous being.
an offering of food in a religious manner to one's deceased ancestors.
food got as alms.
an elephant, whose legs are very thick.
the offering of food as oblation to the manes.
the act or an instance of smashing as to make the object shattered into pieces or a shapeless mass.

a man of unsound mental health; a mad fellow.
arrogance; disdain; disdainfulness; haughtiness.
ಕ್ಷಣ ಚಿತ್ತ, ಕ್ಷಣ ಪಿತ್ತ kṣaṇa citta, kṣaṇa pitta the quality of being fickle, inconsistent, indecisive; fickleness; ಪಿತ್ತ ತಲೆಗೇರು pitta talegēru to become crazy or mad; 2. to become very much enraged.
a kind of inferior gem.

a small, solid mass formed in some gall-bladders or bile ducts, formed of cholesterol or, occasionally, of calcium salts, and sometimes obstruct the flow of bile, causing pain, jaundice, and other symptoms; biliary calculus: gall-stone.
a membranous, pear-shaped sac closely connected by various ducts to the liver, in which excess gall or bile, is stored and concentrated; the gall-bladder.
disorder caused in the production and function of bile in the body.
excessive frequency and looseness of bowel movements caused by bile disorders.
the creeper Tinosporia cordifolia ( = Menispermum cordifolium, = Cocculus cordifolius) of Menispermaceae family.
the largest glandular organ in vertebrate animals, located in the upper or anterior part of the abdomen, that secretes bile; the liver.
a kind of disorder characterised by the inability of the tastebuds to recognise taste, caused by the malfunction of the bile-system.
a grandfather of one's father.
a fever caused by the malfunction of the bile-system in the body.
any disorder caused by the bile in the body.
a vessel (astral tube) in the body the pulsation in which indicates the soundness of the bile-system.
= ಪಿತ್ತಪಾಪಡಾ.
a kind of herb used in treating bilious diseases.
a particular body constitution in which bile is produced more than in the normal case; the nature of the body that is easily affected by the bile-humour.
excess production of bile juice in the body (causing various types of disorders).
unsoundness of the mind; madness.
